ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I took Italian because it fit into my schedule. I started this class with little to no interest in the language, and after one semester I am determined to become fluent. This was a phenomenal and fun class, and I learned so, so much. Everyday I left the class feeling like I had made tons of progress. If Papallo teaches this class in the future, don't hesitate to at least shop it - it was a great experience.

I don't think you can go wrong when it comes to Italian 110 professors, but take it with Papallo--he's great! Clearly knew what he was doing as a professor but perhaps more importantly was extremely enthusiastic about wanting you to learn the language too. Honestly the class went by more quickly despite meeting every day than a lot of my other courses. As you'd expect with an L1 language, there are regular evaluations in class of your writing and speaking abilities, and all were very fair, I thought. Overall, it was great fun--grazie Professor Papallo!

I would definitely recommend Italian to another student. I don't really like language but this is a pretty nice language that is relatively easy to learn. Especially coming with a Spanish background in high school.
Italian 110 is an awesome elementary class. It gives you a strong foundation for the language, while not overwhelming you with small details and a lot of work.
Yes. It is quite a bit of work to keep on top of all the vocabulary and grammar; however, it is very fun and worth the time you put in.
If you find Italian interesting and have an ambition to visit Italy, take this course; you will be speaking Italian in no time!

It's more work than I think 1.5 credits deserves, but I like knowing that I can speak and read and write basic Italian sentences. Learning the language is definitely easier if you have a background in other Romance languages (especially Spanish!!) or Latin. If you don't have any particular reason to take another language, choose Italian!
